places_with_reviews.name: Golu Devta Temple (Bell Temple), Ghorakhal

reviews.text: Lord Golu is the local God of the Kumaon region of state of Uttarakhand. his temple is situated between the mountains the weather of this place is awesome and you can get a proper view of Nainital from here. The temple has uncountable bells put by people who worship to fulfill their dreams and complete their wishes. Here people keep a letter of dreams or what they want written there

The Golu Devta Temple, known as the "The Bell Temple". Thousands of Bell from gate to all over around. It is a unique temple with full of several sizes Bells and hand-written prayer letters. It is widely believed that devotees prayers are fulfilled. several devotees in the temple for darshan and puja. The ambience was serene. It was a blissful visit to the temple. The temple is adorned with countless bells donated by devotees. Parking area approach road isn't very great and broken on multiple places ...

Golu Devta Temple
Ghorakhal, Nainital

The deity worshipped in this temple is called 'Nyay Golu Devta' and is believed to impart instant justice to his devotees.

The temple is located at a height of about 6,600 ft above sea level, and is also known to tourists & devotees as the 'Bell Temple', due to the MILLIONS of bells tied there by eager devotees in the pursuit of justice. These millions of bells tied on each side of the temple, inside, outside, along the corridors and in every available vacant space within & without the temple signify the faith of the devotees in 'Golu Devta' as he is known in these parts.

Many of these bells are accompanied by hand-written requests by devotees to dispense justice, of which also there are several thousands that can be seen tied to every available support...

This is one location that literally oozes belief and divinity...

There is also a belief that a newly married couple who comes here for darshan, ensures that their relationship endures for seven births.

The temple is also home to the idols of several other Gods & Goddesses, each of which is surrounded by thousands of bells. It is quaintly believed that the size of the bell is directly proportional to the magnitude of the prayer that has been fulfilled!

This famous temple is easily accessible from Nainital, Kathgodam & Haldwani

The place is peaceful and serene. Never seen any temple like this before. Here the belief is that with every wishe you have to tie a bell in the temple. People have also noted down the date of completion of there wishes. The views from the temple are amazing. Must visit on your trip to nanital.

Peace, calm, positive vibrations, power, there are so many adjectives to be added here. The place is magical. Definitely a must visit temple. It’s not very commercialised hence remains untouched. A definite visit during Aarti time the places becomes magical.

places_with_reviews.name: Naukuchiatal

reviews.text: Take a risk, go off road as the view is really worth. Recommend going there towards the evening when there's breeze and the feel is more relaxing. Make sure your driver knows that it's off road and the Car is safe to go there.

Amazing boats. Decorated like kashmir boats. This lake is beautiful surrounded with mountains. Must visit. Enjoy boating with your family and friends. Starting price is Rs 600 varies according to the boat size and look. You can share the price with more people if you are less people.

It's Dal lake of Bhimtal...

Sikara ride is must here.
Rs. 500 per ride for 30 min.
A beautiful place to spend time with your family and loved ones .Many activities are also there like kayaking , boating etc . Definitely a fun place to be
Crowd wise better than Nainital, also here are so many aesthetic cafes

places_with_reviews.name: Ghorakhal mandir

reviews.text: Golu Devta ( goljyu devta) a famous deity of kumaun. Golu devta is also known as the incarnation of lord shiva.  This Temple is famous for its justice policy. People write their wishes on paper and tie it there. When there wish is completed then they offer bells in this temple. That's why there sare soo many bells in this temple.

This place ❤️ vibe is just so pure & magical. 1000% must visit.
Recommend to visit in morning around 7:30 for Aarti & you would treat yourself such a Divine experience. The way everyone involves you in the pooja & the temple staff, Poojari ji & regular people are so good, sweet & helpful would treat you so good. Everyone around you creates such a positive, happy environment that it adds so much to the vibe. Would try to come here atleast atleast once every year.

The vibe of the mandir is just so great. The mandir is of Golu Devta. Golu Devta, is said to be an incarnation of Lord Shiva and the temple is one of the main attractions in Ghorakhal.

Thousands of bells are their in the mandir. Such a great vibe and location. From the stairs of the temple u can see bhimtal lake. The view is amazing.

From the bells hanging all around and the vows written on the papers of the devotees, it can be clearly inferred that Golu Devta is worshiped as a just deity in the Devbhoomi.

Thousands of bells tied all over the temple are a symbol of people's faith in Golu Devta.

While Ghorakhal is famous for its natural beauty, it is a spiritual and important religious place.

There is a crowd of devotees throughout the year.

There is a lot of activity in the temple during Navratras and Shravan month.
It's a beautiful temple I ever visited... Neat and clean temple... No irritating priest ....  must visit in nainital

very nice Temple with few steps to climb and maybe 1 crore bells, some being really huge. Definitely worth the visit.
we had started from Nainital at 10am with same driver and car we used earlier day (Kanta Sah, great guy from uttarakhand travels) visited Kainchi Dham, Ghodakhal temple, Tea garden and Apple orchard, even saw the beautiful house where Sri Rabindranath Tagore stayed.

places_with_reviews.name: Naukuchia Tal Lake

reviews.text: Another lake in Nainital. It gets its name from the nine corners it is supposed to have. If you are travelling all the way from Nainital to visit it the question that could haunt you is ' was it worth it?
Awesome experience of boating in naukuchiatal lake, less crowded and clean.

It's famous for adventure sports where one can try kayaking, zipline, waterbouncing, air bouncing, climbing, boating etc but one thing I'ld like to say is that it depends upon how you bargain like he asked for 800rs per person and finally we gave 200rs for three so you need to ask from many  boatmen for that and  if you are coming with friends do enjoy it

Great place to spend some quality time with your family or friends. There are a number of adventure sporting activities that one can experience here including kayaking, water zorb, lake crossing, etc. Apart from that there are shikara and paddle boats available for a calm boating experience.

Best place to visit during your stay in Bhimtal    The lake is huge and has many different types of boating facilities. Be it solo partner or with your family. Avoid a famous cafe beside the lake called Colonels cafe. It only looks good.

places_with_reviews.name: Sattal Water Fall

reviews.text:
Set amongst dense forests of oak and pine trees, Sattal waterfall is one of the few unspoiled places to visit in Uttarakhand. The place is a paradise for bird watching.
A hike of around 1.5km will take you to the fall. Carry something for munching as you would not find any shop once you start the hike.
The best time to go is early morning or before the sunset.
Wonderful trek, really an offbeat destination

Amazing.... Refreshing... Scenic... This is the Best Waterfall I have ever been to and The Best place in recent times that I have visited... So Fresh.... Clicked a lot of Beautiful birds... The Water is so Pure.

A perfect escape in nature with your family and friends.
A lovely hike of 1-2 kilometres to this waterfall from sattal lake.
Entry fees to this reserve is 10rs per person.
On long weekends it gets densely crowded, however if you want this fall just for yourself visit on weekdays.
Nice place to visit around Nainital, those who couldn’t visit Nainital due to overcrowding, can easily visit here to explore this beautiful place/lake/activities.

places_with_reviews.name: Hanuman Mandir Bhakti Dham Hindu Temple

reviews.text:
This temple and ashram is in the way to Naukuchiyal lake . A large hanuman statue is the main attraction. Temple carvings and minars are great and beautiful.

A cave passage is here. Decorated with colourful stones. Inside the building there is a prayer hall and yoga hall. Maunimaa photo is installed here. This premises is belonging to the Bhakti dam Asram.

#hanumanmandirbhaktidamtemple

Oh My God. What great place this is. We were just passing by this Temple and we couldn't move further without visiting this. The tall God Hanuman Murti is so beautiful. Apart from the temple, this is a great scenic place. It offers an awesome hill view. Since paragliding place is nearby, you'll get to see people flying from there.

Devine Destination • Peaceful • 22ft Hanuman idol

This is a famous temple of Lord Hanuman. It is highly peaceful and divine place and a must visit for every tourist. Unlike other temples, this temple despite being famous, remains less crowded and peaceful. Surroundings are clean and the temple is well maintained. It is near Naukuchiyatal lake. It houses a 22 feet idol of Lord Hanuman. One can visit this temple on the way to Naukuchiyataal lake.

Very beautiful Hanuman Mandir near Naukuchiatal lake with a huge Hanuman statue. The view from this temple is just awesome with a lot of greenery, parachutes flying in the sky and the mountains touching the clouds.
Its a beautiful Hanuman temple with very big statue and cave-like entry

places_with_reviews.name: Bhim Taal Lake

reviews.text: Good as much as naine lake , i visit here first time with my car , even if you having 10 15k kilometres driving experience , you can go their with own vehicle. Also this spot having one advantage of activities like paragliding. So must visit place.

Bhimtal Lake, nestled in the serene landscapes of Uttarakhand, emerges as the perfect refuge for those seeking a peaceful and picturesque getaway. During our exploration of the lakes in Uttarakhand, Bhimtal stood out as not just a destination but a serene base camp offering tranquility, accessibility, and budget-friendly accommodation.
One of the key advantages of choosing Bhimtal as a base is its strategic location. Positioned amidst the cluster of lakes in Uttarakhand, it serves as a perfect hub for exploring the nearby lakes, including Nainital. The ease of access to various lakes makes it a convenient choice for those wanting to soak in the beauty of multiple destinations without the hassle of constant travel.
Like its counterparts, offers the enchanting experience of boating on its serene waters. Additionally, the presence of a small island with an aquarium museum adds a unique touch to the overall charm of the place. Exploring the island and its attractions is a pleasant diversion from the routine boating experience.
While the food options around Bhimtal may be fewer compared to more bustling destinations, the simplicity of the meals offered by our hotel, Treebo Trend Vista Lago, was a delight. The combination of simplicity and deliciousness added to the overall charm of our stay, making it a satisfying culinary experience.

This lake is so beautiful. You will get an amazing life time experience here, once miss Nainital but should not miss this.

Also you will get different food here.

Main attraction point is Bhimeshwas Mandir and Kechuli Devi Mandir.

Mesmerizing View of Nature.
You must definitely go for the Boat Ride.
Weather is pleasant in most parts of the year.
Avoid Rains.
It is the second largest lake of Uttarakhand by surface area after Tehri Lake. Lot of wildlife can be seen nearby.

The fish species found in the lake are common snowtrout, catla, rohu, silver carp (Hypophthalmichthys molitrix) and grass carp (Ctenopharyngodon idella).

Overall excellent plant to calm oneself.
A nice and upscale place with beautiful cafes, and restaurants and hotels. One can enjoy boating in the Tal, in country boats. Life jackets are compulsory for everyone.

places_with_reviews.name: Bhimeshwar Hindu Temple

reviews.text: Very peaceful temple. The shiva linga is very glorious. But temple sides are dirty quite. Free entry. Jai bholenath
Simply divine! A peaceful temple situated beside the Bhimtal lake.

If you are planning to visit Bhimtal, so must visit this temple.
You will get positive vibes there.

Har Har Mahadev
This is a beautiful serene temple of huge devotion and spiritual connection. Clean, full of positive vibes and one can pay respect while listening to bells and prayers.

Peaceful and serene. This is historical temple where Pandavas worshipped God Shiva. It is located along Bhimtal lake. Enough space to pray and worship. There is facility for shoe rack, hand wash and benches to sit. The fresh air from lake makes the atmosphere more religious and pure. Must visit if one goes to Bhimtal.

places_with_reviews.name: Kumaon Mandal vikas Nigam Ltd. Parichay Resort Tourist Lodge/ Naukuchiyatal

reviews.text: Good location, very peaceful. Food is like home food. It has a private area from where you can directly access the lake. It has ample parking. The rooms are spacious and have views of the lake though obstructed by trees.

We stayed at KMVN Parichay for New Year Celebrations, and it turned out to be a good decision. We liked the property located by the lakeside, perfect setting in a serene environment. They have a private jetty, providing easy access to the lake. The food was good and fresh. The hotel staff was very courteous and friendly.
This hotel is ideal for peaceful relaxation where you can sit idle for hours. We were sitting idle, soaking in the winter sun. We had a lot of fun during our stay and had bonfires in the night with lots of snacks to eat and drinks.
We booked rooms in 3 different categories Cottage, Royal Premium, and Super Deluxe rooms for our family and friends, and we were not disappointed with any of these.
I would recommend KMVN Parichay for a peaceful stay in a serene environment with a lake view. However, if you’re looking for luxurious amenities, this might not be the right place. I hope this helps!

I recently stayed at Parichay KMVN lodge in Naukuchiatal and had a great experience. The hotel is a basic property with a beautiful location and a serene environment. The hotel has its private jetty, and all the rooms are lake-facing, providing an excellent view of the lake. The food served at the hotel is homely and good. However, the hotel has limited food options. The hotel staff is good, and the service is satisfactory.
I met a fellow traveler who mentioned that the hotel is ideal for peace lovers who want to relax and sit idle for hours reading books or just lazing around. They also mentioned that the hotel is nearby Nainital and has a beautiful lake of nine corners. They had a lot of fun during their stay and had bonfires on both nights with lots of snacks to eat and plenty to drink.
Overall, I would recommend Parichay KMVN lodge to anyone looking for a peaceful and serene environment with a beautiful view of the lake. However, if you’re looking for luxurious amenities, this might not be the right place for you. I hope this helps!

We stayed here for 2 nights from April 1st to 3rd, 2024. We just wanted to relax, vegetate and stroll around the lush greenery and forest paths inside and outside the property during our stay. The property had a very low occupancy during this time, which actually helped us relax better and get more personalized service. The property location, greenery and the prime viewpoint of the lake is simply exceptional. Everywhere you look around, you'll be awed by the lush greenery, well maintained lawns and flower beds. The view of the lake during early mornings and evenings is magical. The property when lit up at night with the lovely lake backdrop, looks enchanting.

Room: We opted for the largest room on the ground floor of the colonial heritage bungalow, and it felt amazing. The room is massive and required as many as 5+ tubelights to light up the entire space. The wooden furniture was also well appointed. The stone paneled walls, high ceiling with antique wooden beams and fireplace (ornamental) took us back in time to the colonial bungalows of yore.

Food: The food was reasonably priced and the in-room service was efficient, probably due to low season. The room charges are on MAP, which means that breakfast and dinner was included. Both the menus were decently varied, well presented and served and tasted good to our palate. The preparations were homely and lightly spiced.

Service: As already mentioned, the service was prompt and efficient during our stay. The resort manager was very cordial and warm in dealing with us both on calls during booking and in-person during the stay.

Jetty: The resort has it's own private jetty where you can order a boating service in advance. We availed a very relaxing private boating service from here.

The only issue that we faced was some dust and cleanliness niggles when we checked in our room. However within 10 minutes of calling the reception with our concern, one sweeper came and cleaned our room properly. Overall we really loved staying at this property and highly recommend it to others. Will definitely return again...

By far the best experience in UK.  We had stayed earlier near Bhimtal but this is a hidden gem.

Loved our stay at Parichay, we had a cottage facing the lake.  The staff was very courteous and friendly.

Mr.Naresh the manager was very accommodating and supportive.  The help staff Mukesh and team were very welcoming.

Best part, the stay includes breakfast and dinner at a nominal room cost.

The rooms were spic and span, bathroom were very neat and tidy, heating is there.  TV is provided along with heating kettle.

We went for boating from the hotel itself as it's lake facing, pick up and drop for boating (600) was available.

Will be coming soon to see our friends at Parichay and spend a good time

Sharing some memories from our trip :)
